Text:
(That heiress must be loaded. I'm gonna get a huge
reward just from doing a little digging on a guy's
faults.)

(Okay, which one of these houses looks big enough to
be home to a guy the most powerful girl in town would
consider marrying...)

(That alone is enough to narrow down the list of
candidates quite a bit.)
Zeta looks at the large houses.

Then she happens upon the biggest house, where people
and carts are bustling in and out, carrying wooden boxes
filled with goods.

These are for the young master's wedding! Handle them
with care, ya barbarians!
Aye, Foreman!

(Wedding goods... Looks like we've got an engaged man
at this house.)

(Hmm...This mansion is just as big and as grand as
that heiress's mansion... Looks like they've got
plenty of wealth.)

So I guess the only way she's got the upper-hand is
in fighting ability...
Hmm?!

Just when Zeta thought she'd figured everything out,
a young man walks out of the mansion. She quietly
hides herself.
Good work, everyone.
Master! Is something wrong?

It's not much, but I've prepared drinks and light
refreshments for everyoneâ€”come inside and
take a break when you reach a stopping point.

Oh, thank you, sir... You are too kind to lowly
workmen like us.
Hey, you lot! Thank him, too!

Y-Yes, sir! Thank you so much, young master!
And congratulations on your wedding!
Haha, thanks. I'm glad to have your support.

Zeta, who has been watching from the shadows, is in
silent awe.

(Ooh...looks like he's got good social skills. I like
that he's not too hard on his subordinates.)

(She'd said he was feeble...but he doesn't look that
overly humble or mean to me.)

Zeta waits for the "young master" to go back inside
the mansion before following him.

After circling the mansion and finding a place to
sneak in, she silently creeps inside...

Zeta masks her presence to remain undetected by the
servants and inhabitants as she walks through the
mansion.
(I wonder where the young master is headed?)

Her object of study stops in the kitchen and grabs
enough food for two before entering the sunniest
room in the mansion.
(Whose room is this?)

Making sure there is no one else around, Zeta
cracks the door open and looks inside.

It's lunchtime, Mother. I've brought your favorite,
bean and vegetable soup. The cook says it's
particularly good today.
Oh, really? I look forward to it.

Inside the bedroom, an elegant woman is sitting up
in bed.
Zeta's nostrils expand.
(I smell medicine... Is she ill?)

The young man brings out a table, wiping it with a
damp cloth before setting lunch for two. He then
opens a window to let in some air before turning
to face the woman.

You're looking well today, Mother. Once the sun isn't
so harsh, would you like to go on a walk?

Oh, don't worry about me, dear. You're going to be
married soon. Don't you have preparations to make?

Now, don't say that. It's because I'm going to be
married off soon that I want to cherish what time
I have left with my family.

With my brother and father busy with work, I'd at
least like to make some memories with my mother.

The lady furrows her brows and smirks at her son's
teasing.

Once you join their family, you need to be just as
good to your wife as you are to me.

I know. I won't be a sorry excuse for a husband who
doesn't cherish his life partner.

Now, let's eat lunch. The cook said there would be
dessert if you had the appetite for it.

The village children and I went raspberry picking
this morning and we gave our haul to the cook.

The two begin their peaceful lunch, and Zeta quietly
shuts the door.

(Okay, he's a family man, caring for his sick
mother...)

(And he has a good rapport with the village children.
Looks like this young man is very nurturing.)

Zeta crosses her arms and tilts her head in
confusion.
(Hmm...I dunno what to make of this.)

(I was gonna just do a quick investigation, give the
heiress the intel, get the reward, and tie this up
quickly...)

(But while he isn't a national treasure, he's
a normal, nice guy...)
(Well...guess I'll dig a little deeper.)

After the young man finishes his lunch and leaves his
mother's room, Zeta returns to her investigation.

After returning the dishes to the kitchen, the young
man goes to his own room. Zeta follows, watching him
through a crack in the door.

(That's a lot of books... Makes sense, since she said
he's a bookworm.)

(There's medical textbooks...nutritional textbooks...
I guess those are for his mother?)

(Magic books...management strategy books...novels and
picture books... I can't really tell what his tastes are from
his bookshelf alone.)

(Unless he's just a book collector for collection's
sake, this means he's a very driven and diligent
man.)

Zeta smirks as she watches the young man head
towards his desk.
Ah hah. Now I see...

After that, Zeta eavesdrops on the conversations
between the servants and merchants who come
and go, to learn their opinions of the young man.
(He's got an ace reputation...)

After some time has passed, she returns to the young
man's room. Nobody is inside.
(He probably went on a walk with his mother.)

Zeta slips into his room and meticulously combs
through the contents of his desk.

(It's just a normal desk... There's no hidden
compartments or anything.)

(I gave the other rooms a once over...and I couldn't
find any evidence of a girlfriend or a secret crush.)
Well...I have my verdict.

Murmuring this, Zeta erases all traces of her presence
and leaves the mansion. She then heads straight for
the dark knight heiress's mansion...
